intro: Gonolobus congestus, commonly known as the clustered horned morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers with prominent, horn-like structures on the petals, which give it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Gonolobus congestus is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
